org.name: AllenAI
org.notes: Slogan is AI for the common good
opencode.notes: Multiple repos with training, architecture and fine-tuning code available
llmdata.notes: Dolma training data released and documented in exemplary way
llmweights.notes: OLMo 7B and many training checkpoints available
rldata.notes: Instruction tuning datasets documented and made available in exemplary ways
rlweights.notes: Full model weights made available
license.notes: Apache 2.0
code.notes: repositories and code well-described, commented and documented
architecture.notes: Architectured documented in detail in model card, preprint, and technical blog posts
preprint.notes: Preprint describes model architecture, training and fine-tuning data, and training and SFT pipelines
modelcard.notes: Model card provides broad overview and links to full details
datasheet.notes: Data sheets and documentation available for the datasets used, linked here is Dolma
api.notes: Available through HuggingFace though model is too large to run on free inference API

org.name: bigscience-workshop
opencode.notes: Repository provides a guided overview to all components
llmdata.notes: Data made available & documented in detail in repo and preprint
llmweights.notes: Model made available on github
rldata.notes: From the documentation 'xP3 (Crosslingual Public Pool of Prompts) is a collection of prompts & datasets across 46 of languages & 16 NLP tasks'
rlweights.notes: Fine-tuned checkpoint available for download
license.notes: Code licensed under Apache 2.0, model under bespoke 'Responsible AI License' which imposes some limitations
code.notes: Code well documented and actively maintained
architecture.notes: Architecture described in preprint, code available in github repo, recipe on HuggingFace
preprint.notes: Preprint (updated June 2023) of 65 pages + 10 page appendix
paper.notes: Peer-reviewed paper of 9 pages + 114 page appendix describes the multitask finetuning (instruction tuning) of BLOOM (see preprint) to form BLOOMZ
modelcard.notes: Model card
datasheet.notes: Dataset documented in dataset card at HuggingFace
api.notes: Petals API via HuggingFace not always available ('not enough hardware capacity')

org.name: LLM360
opencode.notes: amber-train repository includes code for training and finetuning.
llmdata.notes: data well-documented and openly available
llmweights.notes: 360 model checkpoints released
rldata.notes: RL and fine-tuning data shared and documented
rlweights.notes: Finetuned model available for download.
license.notes: Everything licensed under Apache 2.0
code.notes: Code documented in helpful readme.md files but only partly inline.
architecture.notes: Architecture described in preprint, but not all details documented.
preprint.notes: Preprint describes architecture, design choices, training and fine-tuning.
modelcard.notes: Model card doesn't specify use or limitations
datasheet.notes: Concise description (better than most), but doesn't specify funders, purposes, representativeness, legal status as prescribed by datasheets industry standard
api.notes: Free Huggingface inference API.

org.name: LAION-AI
opencode.notes: Code includes guide for developers
llmdata.notes: Datasets documented in detail and recipes for cleaning up and downloading provided in code notebooks.
llmweights.notes: Model weights in several variants downloadable through HuggingFace
rldata.notes: OpenAssistant Conversations is 'a human-generated, human-annotated assistant-style conversation corpus consisting of 161443 messages distributed across 66497 conversation trees, in 35 different languages, annotated with 461292 quality ratings' (preprint)
rlweights.notes: RLHF weights not separately released
license.notes: Apache 2.0
code.notes: Separate website provides entry point to comprehensive documentation
architecture.notes: Instructions to tune the pipeline on training data
preprint.notes: Preprint describes creation of OpenAssistant Conversations corpus for instruction tuning, but not the base LLM, hence partial.
paper.notes: No peer-reviewed paper or published data audit found

org.name: Tshinghua University
org.notes: OpenChat notes 'We are a student team from Tsinghua University'
opencode.notes: Repository offers a large amount of fairly well-organized code for data curation and model
llmdata.notes: Pretraining data for Mistral is nowhere disclosed or documented
llmweights.notes: Mistral 7B weights available via Mistral repository
rldata.notes: Preprint says shareGPT dataset 'collected from sharegpt.com' but not disclosed or made available by this project
rlweights.notes: Instruction-tuned model weights made available via HuggingFace
license.notes: Code and model released under Apache 2.0
code.notes: There is plenty of code in the github repository but only some of it is documented
architecture.notes: Architecture quite well described in preprint
preprint.notes: Preprint describes the model architecture and instruction tuning approach, though is hampered by building on notoriously closed Llama2
paper.notes: Paper reviewed and accepted for ICLR 2024
modelcard.notes: There is a model card that provides some details on architecture and evaluation
api.notes: Model too large to load onto HuggingFace free inference API, so only available through Inference Endpoints or package

org.name: togethercomputer
llmdata.notes: Training data curated and shared in separate repository
llmweights.notes: Model weights available via HuggingFace
rldata.notes: From the documentation 'This is our attempt to create a large instruction dataset of medium quality along with a smaller high quality instruciton dataset (OIG-small-chip2).'
rlweights.notes: RL weights not separately made available
license.notes: Apache 2.0
code.notes: Actively maintained repository
architecture.notes: Architecture and recipe for reproducing model provided
preprint.notes: Preprint describes LM base (Pythia) but not instruction tuning details
paper.notes: No peer-reviewed paper or data audit found
modelcard.notes: Model card partially available but fairly minimally specified

org.name: Cerebras + Schramm
opencode.notes: Some of the training code available in GigaGPT, but fine-tuning
llmdata.notes: Eleuther AI's The Pile
llmweights.notes: base model available via Cerebras
rldata.notes: Alpaca GPT4
rlweights.notes: Finetuned model weights available
license.notes: Licensing situation unclear as model page mentions no license (base model is licensed Apache 2.0)
code.notes: Code only sparsely documented
architecture.notes: Described in preprint
modelcard.notes: Only serves as as advertising for the model
api.notes: Available through HuggingFace inference API

org.name: TogetherComputer
opencode.notes: Code for datasets made available in exemplary ways; code for training and tuning harder to find
llmdata.notes: RedPajama-Data-1T made available on HuggingFace
llmweights.notes: Base is RedPajama-INCITE-7B-Base
rldata.notes: The model was trained on a large collection of diverse data, including Chain-of-Thought (CoT), Public Pool of Prompts (P3) dataset, Natural-Instructions (NI) dataset.
rlweights.notes: Instruction-tuned version made available in paralle with base version
license.notes: Models licensed under Apache 2.0, but note that the data itself is variably licensed and so imposes some limitations.
code.notes: Code for base LLM and instruction tuning datasets beautifully documented; code specifying training and fine-tuning sparsely documented.
architecture.notes: Architecture detailed on model card, but crucial parts appear to be forked from GPT-NeoX
preprint.notes: No preprint found
modelcard.notes: Model card and readme provide details on datasets and
datasheet.notes: Data sheet includes links to data and recipes to create from scratch
api.notes: Hosted inference API available through HuggingFace

project.notes: A new DPO model from AllenAI called Tülu
org.name: AllenAI
opencode.notes: Important effort to make available fine-tuning procedure and source code. Not seen a repository for base model training yet.
llmdata.notes: Based on Llama2 so nothing known about training data
llmweights.notes: Base model made available via Meta (requires privacy-defying signup)
rldata.notes: Codebase used for fine-tuning this model and made available for others
rlweights.notes: Fine-tuned weights available
license.notes: Meta Community License and AI2 Impact license
code.notes: OpenInstruct code well-documented
architecture.notes: Post-llama2 aspects quite well described in papers, e.g. DPO based on Zephyr Beta, but base model is irrevocably closed
preprint.notes: Preprint covers the training of Tulu2
modelcard.notes: Model card offers little details
datasheet.notes: Some datasheets available (for instruction tuning), but base model entirely undocumented.
api.notes: Available via various APIs

org.name: MosaicML
opencode.notes: Codebase part of LLM foundry
llmdata.notes: C4 is part of the dataset but a precise specification of source data is hard to find
llmweights.notes: Weights available via HuggingFace
rldata.notes: dolly-hhrlhf, combination of Databrick dolly-15k dataset and a filtered subset of Anthropic HH-RLHF
license.notes: CC-by-SA 3.0
code.notes: LLM Foundry codebase is well-documented and in active development.
architecture.notes: Architecture reasonably well-documented
modelcard.notes: Modelcard is somewhat lacking in detail
datasheet.notes: Datasheet not available; data somewhat documented in blog post at link
api.notes: API via HuggingFace

org.name: MosaicML
opencode.notes: Codebase part of LLM foundry
llmdata.notes: C4 is part of the dataset but a precise specification of source data is hard to find
llmweights.notes: Weights available via HuggingFace
rldata.notes: dolly-hhrlhf, combination of Databrick dolly-15k dataset and a filtered subset of Anthropic HH-RLHF
license.notes: CC-by-SA 3.0
code.notes: LLM Foundry codebase is well-documented and in active development
architecture.notes: Architecture reasonably well-documented

org.name: Intel
opencode.notes: Mistral base model is not open, but repo gives sample code for fine-tuning based on that
llmdata.notes: Mistral has not disclosed anything about its training data
llmweights.notes: Based on Mistral 7B 0.1
rldata.notes: RL dataset used for post-training is shared and available
rlweights.notes: finetuned model made openly available by Intel
license.notes: Apache 2.0
code.notes: Mistral remains closed so only documentation pertains to fine-tuning steps, but that code is quite well documented, so partial.
architecture.notes: Described in on HuggingFace model card and a Medium post
preprint.notes: A medium post is apparently the only scientific documentation of this model
modelcard.notes: No model card for Mistral base model portion.
datasheet.notes: SlimOrca dataset is described as part of OpenOrca (but partial since Mistral data is incrutable)
package.notes: Code for running with transformers provided by Intel
api.notes: Provided through HuggingFace but model too large to run via inference API, local deployment or paid access needed

project.notes: Vicuna is a chat assistant trained by fine-tuning LLaMA on user-shared conversations collected from ShareGPT.
org.name: LMSYS
org.notes: According to its website, 'The Large Model Systems Organisation develops large models and systems that are open, accessible and scalable'
opencode.notes: Actively maintained repository
llmdata.notes: Vicuna is fine-tuned LLaMA, and LLaMA in turn is based on 'publicly available datasets' that are not all specified or easily downloadable.
llmweights.notes: Unlike Vicuna 13B v0, these weights do not require applying delta
rldata.notes: From the documentation 'We will not release the ShareGPT dataset'. Also 'Vicuna v1.3 is fine-tuned from LLaMA with supervised instruction fine-tuning. The training data is around 140K conversations collected from ShareGPT.com.'
rlweights.notes: No model weights are shared for the instruction tuning
license.notes: From the documentation 'Vicuna is based on LLaMA and should be used under LLaMA's model license.'
code.notes: Code is quite well-documented and released as part of the FastChat framework.
preprint.notes: Preprint covers training of the Vicuna model.
modelcard.notes: Minimal model card, but many details are not provided or have to be pieced together from elsewhere.
api.notes: Support provided for several APIs OpenAI restful, HuggingFace, Langchain

org.name: BlinkDL/RWKV
opencode.notes: Various community-contributed enhancements available
llmdata.notes: Trained on The Pile. Recent versions also build on Red Pajama (https://huggingface.co/datasets/togethercomputer/RedPajama-Data-1T)
llmweights.notes: Model weights released across different HuggingFace spaces
rldata.notes: Instruction tuning data not separately available. Documentation 'These are RWKV-4-Pile 1.5/3/7/14B models finetuned on Alpaca, CodeAlpaca, Guanaco, GPT4All, ShareGPT and more'
rlweights.notes: Weights not separately available.
license.notes: Apache 2.0
code.notes: Code documentation scattered across github repo and HuggingFace spaces
architecture.notes: Architecture described in preprint (LM part) but not all details clearly documented.
preprint.notes: Preprint covers only LLM (RNN based), not instruction fine-tuning, so partial.
paper.notes: No peer-reviewed paper or published data audit known
modelcard.notes: No modelcard, HuggingFace spaces only used to share files
datasheet.notes: No data sheet, HuggingFac spaces only used to share files
api.notes: API via HuggingFace

org.name: KE Technologies
opencode.notes: Repository contains a fair bit of code
llmdata.notes: Open for variants based on BLOOMZ. Closed for variants based on LLaMA, whose pretraining data is nowhere disclosed or documented.
llmweights.notes: LLaMA based but copyright status unclear
rldata.notes: Synthetic BELLE training data in Chinese released in batches
rlweights.notes: Some models available, most only as delta weights requiring separate access to LLaMA
license.notes: Lowest common denominator is non-OSI approved LLaMA licence agreement
code.notes: Quite some documentation on Github, though not all well-organized
architecture.notes: Specified in a fair bit of detail on github
modelcard.notes: No model card found
api.notes: No API found

org.name: Microsoft
opencode.notes: No source code found for pretraining, posttraining, or evaluation
llmdata.notes: No datasets made available and no information on datasets disclosed except very generic claims about filtering for high quality.
llmweights.notes: No base model of the instruction-tuned Phi-3 was released
rldata.notes: No post-training datasets made available and no information on datasets disclosed except very generic claims about filtering for high quality.
rlweights.notes: Instruction-tuned model weights shared through HuggingFace
license.notes: MIT License
code.notes: No source code, so no documentation of source code found
architecture.notes: Architecture described in model card and preprint
preprint.notes: Preprint describes model architecture but not training data, focusing mostly on benchmarks and evalution
modelcard.notes: Model card provides reasonable level of detail
package.notes: Available through development version of transformers
api.notes: Available through HuggingFace API

project.notes: Empowering Large Pre-Trained Language Models to Follow Complex Instructions
org.name: Microsoft & Peking University
opencode.notes: Fast-evolving repository contains WizardLM code
llmdata.notes: Based on LLaMA2, which is claimed to be public but nowhere exactly documented.
llmweights.notes: Based on LLaMA2 weights, which are made conditionally available by Meta.
rldata.notes: The Evol-Instruct V2 dataset contains 196k instruction-following sequences generated from Evol-Instruct
rlweights.notes: Model weights offered in HuggingFace repository
license.notes: Restricted for academic research purposes only. Code and Model diff release under CC-BY-NC-4.0, software code under Apache 2.0
code.notes: Code is only partially documented, not clearly versioned, and appears to be in flux.
architecture.notes: Architecture described in preprint and partly accessible in code repository
preprint.notes: Preprint describes method for creating large amounts of LLM-based synthetic RLHF data and fine-tuning WizardLM based on it
paper.notes: No peer-reviewed paper or data audit found
modelcard.notes: Model card is only a placeholder and generates an error (missing yaml metadata)
datasheet.notes: Dataset card for Evol-Instruct generates an error
api.notes: No API available

org.name: Jon Durbin
org.notes: Only active on GitHub since May 2023
opencode.notes: Repo exists for RL data but only a gist exists for model training and architecture
llmdata.notes: Llama2 training data is nowhere documented or disclosed
llmweights.notes: Llama2, made conditionally available by Meta
rldata.notes: Airoboros, an implementation of the Self-Instruct paper
rlweights.notes: Made available through HuggingFace
license.notes: Licensing left ambiguous because of murky status of OpenAI-derived Self-Instruct data
code.notes: What little code available is not very systematically documented
architecture.notes: Some info can be gleaned at link but most remains undocumented
preprint.notes: No preprint found
modelcard.notes: Instructs reader to look up model card for prior 65B Llama1 version
api.notes: No API found

project.notes: From the readme, "ChatGLM-6B uses technology similar to ChatGPT, optimized for Chinese QA and dialogue. The model is trained for about 1T tokens of Chinese and English corpus, supplemented by supervised fine-tuning, feedback bootstrap, and reinforcement learning wit human feedback. With only about 6.2 billion parameters, the model is able to generate answers that are in line with human preference."
org.name: THUDM
org.notes: Knowledge Engineering Group (KEG) & Data Mining at Tsinghua University
opencode.notes: Some code made available on Github
llmdata.notes: Training data not centrally made available, but described in 2022 ACL paper, appears to be mostly public datasets
llmweights.notes: Model made available through HuggingFace
rldata.notes: docs mention "supervised fine-tuning, feedback bootstrap, and reinforcement learning wit human feedback", but none of the datasets used are clearly specified.
rlweights.notes: No weights or checkpoints corresponding to the delta of the LLM vs RLHF provided
license.notes: Apache 2.0
code.notes: Some documentation available, but a lot of code is not commented or explained.
architecture.notes: Full details architecture not specified in a single place
paper.notes: ACL 2022 paper describes the training of the GLM base model, but the RLHF portion is more recent (there is also a related ICLR paper for a newer generation https://openreview.net/forum?id=-Aw0rrrPUF)
modelcard.notes: No modelcard; the HuggingFace modelcard spot is used just as the homepage for the model.
api.notes: API provided through fastapi uvicorn

org.name: Mistral AI
opencode.notes: repository provides 'minimal code to run our 7B model'
llmdata.notes: No information provided on pretraining data
llmweights.notes: Base LLM model made available for download
rldata.notes: No information provided expect that instruction tuning is done using an unspecified 'variety of publicly available conversation datasets'
rlweights.notes: Instruct version of the model made available but no information on fine-tuning procedure provided
license.notes: Apache 2.0
code.notes: the little code that is available is uncommented and undocumented
architecture.notes: Some information on architecture provided in github repo
preprint.notes: Preprint rehashes marketing blurbs also given in blog and provides no details about pretraining datasets, instruction tuning datasets, or fine-tuning process, hence partial.
modelcard.notes: No model card available, HuggingFace modelcard just points to a corporate blog post
api.notes: API specification provided by vLLM

project.notes: This is based on the 72B version, the largest of 8 available model sizes.
org.name: Alibaba Cloud
org.notes: Qwen (abbr. for Tongyi Qianwen 通义千问) refers to the large language model family built by Alibaba Cloud
opencode.notes: Repository provides sparse source code and some examples for SFT
llmdata.notes: Pretraining data not specified or documented.
llmweights.notes: Also available in smaller model sizes
rldata.notes: Data not specified or documented. Some example code in repo provides directions but no details.
rlweights.notes: Also available in smaller model sizes
license.notes: Qianwen License
code.notes: Repository is fairly well-documented.
architecture.notes: No clear description of architecture found.
preprint.notes: No preprint found.
modelcard.notes: Model card on HF only serves as a pointer to the model, no actual info provided.
package.notes: No specific package provided but integrates well with many widely used packages
api.notes: Available through various APIs

project.notes: StableVicuna-13B is a Vicuna-13B v0 model fine-tuned using reinforcement learning from human feedback (RLHF) via Proximal Policy Optimization (PPO) on various conversational and instructional datasets
org.name: CarperAI
opencode.notes: Some elements of the code made available through HuggingFace
llmdata.notes: Based on LLaMA whose pretraining data has nowhere been disclosed or documented.
llmweights.notes: Model not functional out of the box as weights require a delta computation. From the docs 'StableVicuna-13B cannot be used from the CarperAI/stable-vicuna-13b-delta weights alone. To obtain the correct model, one must add back the difference between LLaMA 13B and CarperAI/stable-vicuna-13b-delta weights.'
rldata.notes: From the documentation 'The reward model used during RLHF was also trained on OpenAssistant Conversations Dataset (OASST1) along with two other datasets Anthropic HH-RLHF, a dataset of preferences about AI assistant helpfulness and harmlessness; and Stanford Human Preferences Dataset a dataset of 385K collective human preferences over responses to questions/instructions in 18 different subject areas, from cooking to legal advice.'
rlweights.notes: The HuggingFace community page has an open question for release of the RL model
license.notes: CC-BY-NC-SA-4.0. License for LLaMA is more murky, hence partial. As they say 'License for the base LLaMA model's weights is Meta's non-commercial bespoke license.'
code.notes: Code is minimally documented and deployment requires non-trivial configuration, e.g. 'StableVicuna-13B cannot be used from the CarperAI/stable-vicuna-13b-delta weights alone. To obtain the correct model, one must add back the difference between LLaMA 13B and CarperAI/stable-vicuna-13b-delta weights.'
architecture.notes: Architecture is described in scattered places, but there is no clear and exhaustive overview.
preprint.notes: Preprint covers only the LLaMA base model, hence partial.
modelcard.notes: Model card provides some information but is not fully worked out as recommended in model card literature.
api.notes: Addressable via FastChat / HuggingFace API

org.name: Technology Innovation Institute
opencode.notes: No source code shared, even though the term "open source" is used.
llmdata.notes: From the documentation 'The key ingredient for the high quality of the Falcon models is their training data, predominantly based (>80%) on RefinedWeb — a novel massive web dataset based on CommonCrawl' (https://huggingface.co/blog/falcon). However, only a small sample is made available.
llmweights.notes: Model weights available through HuggingFace library
rldata.notes: RL data inherited from Baize but provenance not well-documented. From the documentation 'Falcon-40B-Instruct was finetuned on a 150M tokens from Baize mixed with 5% of RefinedWeb data.'
rlweights.notes: No RL weights or checkpoints made available
license.notes: First release came with a legally murky license that was swiftly criticised and now generates a 404. Current documentation 'Falcon-40B-Instruct is made available under the Apache 2.0 license.'
code.notes: No source code found, therefore no documentation found.
architecture.notes: Architecture sketched on HuggingFace as "Falcon-40B-Instruct is a 40B parameters causal decoder-only model built by TII based on Falcon-40B and finetuned on a mixture of Baize."
preprint.notes: Preprint covers the creation and curation of RefinedWeb dataset, but not other aspects of the model, hence partial.
modelcard.notes: Model card on HuggingFace is mostly used to advertise the model, not to document its training and evaluation details.
api.notes: There is no API, and HuggingFace inference API is disabled for this model.

org.name: OpenBMB
org.notes: OpenBMB (Open Lab for Big Model Base), founded by TsinghuaNLP & ModelBest Inc (面壁智能), aims to build foundation models and systems towards AGI.
llmdata.notes: Based on Llama2, which means pretraining data is nowhere disclosed or documented, and described only in the vaguest terms in a corporate preprint released by Meta
llmweights.notes: Download only after requesting access; requires signing a consent form
rldata.notes: UltraFeedback dataset made available along with model release
rlweights.notes: Online materials appear to be in flux and several HuggingFace links generate 404 errors, hence partial
license.notes: Usage requires signing Meta's bespoke 'community license', not an OSI recognised open license
code.notes: Code only covers minimal examples; no documentation available.
architecture.notes: Architecture sketched in online materials.
preprint.notes: Preprint describes creation of UltraFeedback dataset but also offers some detail on training and architecture of UltraRM models
modelcard.notes: Model card on HuggingFace available for 13b (Llama1) model, but not for newer releases, hence partial
datasheet.notes: Datasheet available for RLHF portion, but not for Llama2-based pretraining data, hence partial
api.notes: API not provided and model too big for HuggingFace inference API

project.notes: The Yi series models are the next generation of open-source large language models trained from scratch by 01.AI. Targeted as a bilingual language model and trained on 3T multilingual corpus.
project.license: Apache 2.0 and bespoke Yi Series Community License Agreement 2.1
org.name: 01.AI
opencode.notes: repository contains some code for demos and for instruction tuning, but only sparse examples of code for initial training and model architecture
llmdata.notes: Training data for base model undocumented, though preprint mentions CommonCrawl as one source
llmweights.notes: Base model weights shared via HuggingFace
rldata.notes: Model docs mention COIG but only as an example. Code also shows rm-static is also used in instruction tuning, but not shared.
rlweights.notes: Instruction-tuned weights shared via HuggingFace
license.notes: Model code licensed under Apache 2.0, model weights licensed under Llama-inspired community license with limitations
code.notes: Documentation only describes how to deploy, training and fine-tuning code not available or where available not commented or documented
architecture.notes: Model architecture only described in the most general terms.
preprint.notes: Preprint provides some info on pretraining data (CommonCrawl) but none on instruction tuning dataset.
modelcard.notes: Model card used for advertising and navigation purposes, does not follow general model card specifications.
api.notes: limited access via HF API, otherwise gated and commercially available

project.notes: From the documentation 'Koala is fine-tuned on freely available interaction data scraped from the web, but with a specific focus on data that includes interaction with highly capable closed-source models such as ChatGPT.'
org.name: BAIR
opencode.notes: Code scattered across projects and repositories
llmdata.notes: Repo contains data pipeline for preprocessing. Based on LLaMA which is said to be based on 'publicly available datasets' which are not made directly available.
llmweights.notes: Model weights only made available as a diff against LLaMA. OpenLLaMA provides a possible alternative?
rldata.notes: Datasets described in blog post but not all made available
rlweights.notes: RL weights not made available separately
license.notes: Licensing is 'subject to the model License of LLaMA, Terms of Use of the data generated by OpenAI, and Privacy Practices of ShareGPT'
code.notes: Code scattered across various repositories and not systematically documented.
architecture.notes: Architecture visually illustrated and described in some detail.
preprint.notes: No preprint available
modelcard.notes: No model card available
api.notes: No API available

org.name: Mistral AI
opencode.notes: No training code for Mixtral 8x7B made available
llmdata.notes: No information provided on pretraining data
llmweights.notes: Weights shared via torrent and via HuggingFace
rldata.notes: No information provided online or in the preprint
rlweights.notes: Instruct version of model weights made available but no information on fine-tuning procedure provided
license.notes: Apache 2.0
code.notes: the little code that is available is uncommented and undocumented, and relates to a reference implementation of the 7B version
architecture.notes: Some information on architecture provided in github repo and in preprint
preprint.notes: Preprint describes mixture of experts and evalutaion but provides no details about pretraining datasets, instruction tuning datasets, or fine-tuning process, hence partial.
modelcard.notes: No model card available, HuggingFace modelcard just points to a corporate blog post
api.notes: Only paid API access available

org.name: Stability AI
opencode.notes: No repository with open code related to training, fine-tuning or evaluation found
llmdata.notes: Pretraining data nowhere disclosed or documented, and described only in the vaguest terms in a corporate preprint released by Meta
llmweights.notes: Download only after requesting access; requires signing a consent form

rlweights.notes: Instruction-tuned model weights available
license.notes: Usage requires signing StabilityAI's bespoke 'Stable Beluga Non-Commercial Community License', not an OSI recognised open license

architecture.notes: Says 'Stable Beluga 2 is a Llama2 70B model finetuned on an Orca style Dataset'.
preprint.notes: Preprint from Microsoft describes Orca method of finetuning using GPT4-derived synthetic data, but no details of this particular architecture
modelcard.notes: There is a model card, but it provides only a minimum of detail
api.notes: model too large to run on HuggingFace free inference API

org.name: Stanford University CRFM
llmdata.notes: Based on LLaMA, whose pretraining data is nowhere disclosed or documented.
llmweights.notes: LLaMA based, copyright status unclear
rldata.notes: alpaca_data.json contains 52K instruction-following data we used for fine-tuning the Alpaca model.
rlweights.notes: LLaMA based
license.notes: Pegged to LLaMA licence agreement
code.notes: Insofar as code is made available it is fairly well documented
architecture.notes: Fair bit of documentation available on github repository
preprint.notes: No preprint found; uses the release-by-blogpost playbook
modelcard.notes: No model card found

project.notes: Falcon-180B-Chat is a 180B parameters causal decoder-only model built by TII based on Falcon-180B and finetuned on a mixture of Ultrachat, Platypus and Airoboros.
org.name: Technology Innovation Institute
opencode.notes: No source code shared anywhere. The over 200 github repositories of TII appear to include no LLM or Falcon related code.
llmdata.notes: From the documentation 'The key ingredient for the high quality of the Falcon models is their training data, predominantly based (>80%) on RefinedWeb — a novel massive web dataset based on CommonCrawl' (https://huggingface.co/blog/falcon). However, only a small sample is made available.
llmweights.notes: requires signing up and accepting "acceptable use policy"
rldata.notes: No details provided beyond "finetuned on a mixture of Ultrachat, Platypus and Airoboros".
rlweights.notes: No RL weights or checkpoints made available; fine-tuned 'chat' model only available after signing "acceptable use policy".
license.notes: Released under Falcon 180B TII license (not OSI approved) and a separate "acceptable use policy".
code.notes: No code available, so no code documented.
architecture.notes: Architecture described as  "causal decoder-only" and "optimized for inference", but very few details available.
preprint.notes: Preprint covers the creation and curation of RefinedWeb dataset, but not other aspects of the model, hence partial.
modelcard.notes: Model card on HuggingFace is mostly used to advertise the model, not to document its training and evaluation details.
api.notes: There is no API, and HuggingFace inference API is disabled for this model.

project.notes: This file applies to Orca 2 7B and 13B, both fine-tunes of corresponding Llama2 base models.
project.license: Microsoft Research License, Llama Community License
org.name: Microsoft Research
opencode.notes: No source code made available anywhere for data curation, training, fine-tuning, or evaluation
llmdata.notes: Llama pretraining Data nowhere disclosed or documented, and described only in the vaguest terms in a corporate preprint released by Meta
llmweights.notes: Download only after requesting access; requires signing a consent form
rldata.notes: Instruction-tuning and explanation-tuning data described in preprint, but not disclosed or made available
rlweights.notes: 7B and 13B finetunes of Llama2 made available through HuggingFace
license.notes: Licensed under Microsoft Research License and Meta's bespoke community license, neither OSI recognised
code.notes: Code only covers minimal examples; no documentation available.
architecture.notes: Architecture sketched in corporate preprints, though many details missing.
preprint.notes: Corporate preprint from Microsoft Research has some detail on instruction-tuning, explanation-tuning and evaluation
modelcard.notes: Model card serves as landing page more than careful model documentation
api.notes: Model too large to load on HuggingFace inference library

project.license: CC-BY-NC and C4AI acceptable use policy
org.name: Cohere AI
opencode.notes: No codebase available to study or adjust model architecture, training, or inner workings.
llmdata.notes: No documentation, listing or audit of pre-training data available. Cohere itself identifies it as coheretext-filtered and gives the size as 200Gb.
llmweights.notes: No checkpoint or model prior to SFT and instruction-tuning made available
rldata.notes: Aya Collection (Aya Open Science initiative) is a multilingual collection of 513 million instances of promts and completions including instruction-style templates.
rlweights.notes: Fine-tuned model weights made available for download
license.notes: Licensed under CC-BY-NC and requires agreeing to C4AI acceptable use policy
code.notes: No source code available, so no documentation of code.
architecture.notes: Architecture only sparsely documented.
preprint.notes: No preprint appears to be made available at this time.
paper.notes: No paper known to document the Cohere Command R+ model or architecture.
modelcard.notes: Model card on HF document some aspects but provides no data on training data, instruction-tuning methods
api.notes: API access available only when signing up.

org.name: Google DeepMind
opencode.notes: No pre-training or instructing-tuning code made available. Some developer tools available.
llmdata.notes: No details provided on pre-training data.
llmweights.notes: Base model weights shared via Kaggle, requires privacy-defying access request.
rldata.notes: Documentation says 'These versions of the model are trained with human language interactions and can respond to conversational input, similar to a chat bot.'
rlweights.notes: Instruction-tuned model weights shared via Kaggle, requires privacy-defying access request
license.notes: Bespoke Gemma Community License Agreement and restrictive Terms of Use, neither open in the sense of OSI. Only Inference code shared under Apache 2.0.
code.notes: No pretraining or finetuning code found. No code documentation except for deployment of the open weights.
architecture.notes: Architecture described in very general terms in model card
preprint.notes: No preprint found
modelcard.notes: Model card on Kaggle provides some detail on model internals and evaluation
datasheet.notes: No datasheet found, pre-training and instruction-tuning data nowhere specified.
package.notes: No package provided, access is gated through Kaggle, Vertex Model Garden, Google Cloud
api.notes: No API provided, access gated through Kaggle, Vertex Model Garden, Google Cloud

org.name: Facebook Research
opencode.notes: Repository only offers 'a minimal example to load Llama 2 models and run inference'; no training, fine-tuning, evaluation code made available
llmdata.notes: Data nowhere disclosed or documented, and described only in the vaguest terms in a corporate preprint released by Meta
llmweights.notes: Download only after requesting access; requires signing a consent form
rldata.notes: RLHF data including 1 million Meta-specific tuning prompts not made available (even as it incorporates some open RLHF datasets)
rlweights.notes: Download only after requesting access; requires signing a consent form
license.notes: Usage requires signing Meta's bespoke 'community license', not an OSI recognised open license
code.notes: Code only covers minimal examples; no documentation available.
architecture.notes: Architecture sketched in preprint, though many details missing.
preprint.notes: Corporate preprint quite some detail on pretraining, RLHF, and safety measures but none on datasets.
modelcard.notes: There is a model card, but it provides the absolute minimum of detail, and none whatsoever on training data.
api.notes: API only available behind a privacy-defying signup form

org.name: Nanbeige LLM lab
opencode.notes: github repo contains sparse but clear code for training, tuning, and inference
llmdata.notes: No information on pre-training datasets except a claim of 4.5T tokens. Request for information on HF community was closed without comment.
llmweights.notes: Base model not shared
rldata.notes: No information on finetuning and DPO datasets. Some information provided on request (see link), but official documentation not updated.
rlweights.notes: Model weights for finetuned model shared
license.notes: Apache 2.0 but commercial use requires signup and an additional community license
code.notes: No documentation of the codebase
architecture.notes: Architecture not clearly specified
preprint.notes: No preprint found
modelcard.notes: No model card found
api.notes: No API, but HuggingFace space available

org.name: Facebook Research
opencode.notes: Repository only offers minimal code
llmdata.notes: Data nowhere disclosed or documented, and described only in the vaguest terms in a release blog post
llmweights.notes: Download only after requesting access; requires signing a consent form
rldata.notes: No information available on instruction-tuning.
rlweights.notes: Download only after requesting access; requires signing a consent form
license.notes: Even inspecting the model requires signing Meta Llama 3's bespoke 'community license', not an OSI recognised open license
code.notes: Code only covers minimal examples; no documentation available.
architecture.notes: Architecture sketched in glossy blog post.
preprint.notes: No preprint or any other scientific documentation available.
modelcard.notes: There is a model card, but it provides the absolute minimum of detail, and none whatsoever on training data.

project.notes: HuggingFace profile says 'Solar is a great example of the progress enabled by open source.'
org.name: Upstage AI
opencode.notes: No code repository found
llmdata.notes: Data nowhere disclosed or documented, and described only in the vaguest terms in a corporate preprint released by Meta
llmweights.notes: Download only after requesting access; requires signing a consent form
rldata.notes: No RLHF datasets specified or shared, docs say 'Orca-style dataset, Alpaca-style dataset'
rlweights.notes: Finetuned checkpoints only shared through CC-BY-NC
license.notes: Meta Community License for base model, and CC-BY-NC 4.0 for fine-tuned model weights
code.notes: HuggingFace code only comprises configuration json; no documentation available.
architecture.notes: Precise architecture, training, fine-tuning procedures not given.
preprint.notes: No preprint or any form of scientific docuentation found.
modelcard.notes: HuggingFace model card used mostly as advertising, omits many details on training, fine-tuning, evaluation.
api.notes: API only available by signing up for 'private LLM' service

project.notes: Xwin-LM aims to develop and open-source alignment technologies for large language models
org.name: Xwin-LM
org.notes: Xwin-LM aims to develop and open-source alignment technologies for large language models
opencode.notes: HuggingFace page notes 'to do ":" Release the source code'
llmdata.notes: Data nowhere disclosed or documented, and described only in the vaguest terms in a corporate preprint released by Meta
llmweights.notes: Download only after requesting access; requires signing a consent form
rldata.notes: RLHF data for Llama includes 1 million Meta-specific tuning prompts not made available, no other details known about RLHF and alignment tuning added by Xwin-LM
rlweights.notes: Downloadable model presumably includes RLHF tuning but no documentation available
license.notes: Usage requires signing Meta's bespoke 'community license', not an OSI recognised open license
code.notes: No documentation available.
architecture.notes: No information available beyond that it is based on Llama and "RLHF plays crucial role"
preprint.notes: No preprint available; "Coming soon (Stay tuned)"
modelcard.notes: HuggingFace "model card" used to advertise model, but no details available.
api.notes: API available through vllm and HuggingFace

org.name: OpenAI
opencode.notes: OpenAI has not released any source code related to ChatGPT
llmdata.notes: OpenAI has not released or documented any of the source training data
llmweights.notes: OpenAI has not released model weights for GPT3.5
rldata.notes: OpenAI has not released the instruction-tuning data
rlweights.notes: OpenAI has not released details about RLHF models weights
license.notes: None of the code is open sourced; license unknown.
code.notes: Code is not available, documentation level unknown.
architecture.notes: OpenAI has not clearly documented the LLM+RLHF architecture or its evaluation.
preprint.notes: Preprint describes only the instruction-tuning method; no further papers available.
paper.notes: No peer-reviewed paper documenting this system is available.
modelcard.notes: No modelcard is available for GPT3.5. The linked model card is for GPT3 is dated Sept 2020.
datasheet.notes: OpenAI has not released a datasheet or any other documentation or evaluation of source data.
package.notes: Some third party packages exist; support for them is contingent on OpenAI's whims.
api.notes: API access is only available for commercial users.
